resources.string: Your new diet journal is now easier to use
For each meal, use your mobile phone or tablet to take a picture of what is on your plate
And you will receive comments from your dietitian
I eat plenty of fruits & veggies
I am following a specific diet
Your email format is wrong. Please input a valid email.
This message has failed to send:
Success! Your meal has been logged
Are you sure you want to delete this meal? All photos and comments will be lost
Time for breakfast. Dont skip this first meal of the day to get your body and mood going for the day ahead.
A bit hungry? Dont eat just anything. Get some healthy, satiating snack ideas in the Bonus section.
Lunchtime! Avoid skipping meals, so make sure to eat something right now to avoid snacking for the rest of the day.
Are you getting enough water today? Always drink before you feel thirsty. 8 glasses of water a day is recommended for adequate fluid intake.
Have a light dinner. A heavy meal in the evening may affect your sleep.
Its another beautiful day. Enjoy breakfast while sitting at the table, and follow your meal plan well to avoid the mid-morning munchies!
Think about carrying fruit cups or fruit bags for morning cravings. Easy to carry in your bag at all times.
Lunch is essential, so treat it as such. Take your time, savor every bite, and chew well.
Are you thirsty but hate water? Why not enjoy unsweetened tea, a small decaf, or even an infusion?
Herbal infusions can help you sleep better: chamomile, mint, tarragon, valerian, tilia, or rosemary to help digestion. Sweet dreams!
Eggs, ham, and smoked salmon are great sources of protein for breakfast. Theyll also keep you full through the morning!
Are you feeling hungry even after having breakfast this morning? Drink water or a hot unsweetened drink and wait a few minutes to see if its true hunger.
Take a breather while its peaceful. Eat lunch while comfortably seated, and if necessary, stay away from the busy office. Enjoy this moment and nothing else.
"Do snack cakes tempt you every afternoon? Take away that option. Stay focused on your weight loss goal and have your own healthy snack.
Make the most out of this last meal of the day and spend it with family, without any distractions. Make it a time for discussion and sharing.
Having a good breakfast is essential: a combination of a hot drink, fresh fruit, dairy, and grains. Then youll say goodbye to mid-meal hunger!
If you didnt finish your breakfast today, take the leftover items with you to enjoy as a mid-morning snack.
Be sure to closely follow the structure of your daily meals: raw vegetables, starches, cooked vegetables, protein, lean dairy, and fruit.
"Want to make a cake for your afternoon snack? Check the recipes for healthy options.
Avoid stimulants in the evening: coffee, tea, smartphones, video games...anything that can upset digestion and the quality of your sleep.
Not feeling like taking breakfast? Dont force yourself to finish your meal. Eat what you can and pack the rest. You can eat them as a mid-morning snack.
Time for a break! Step away from your desk, breathe some fresh air, or start a pleasant conversation with your colleagues.
Do you scarf down your lunch in just 10 minutes? If so, dont eat your dessert right away. Instead, wait 20 minutes to know if youre still hungry.
Ignore all the temptations of candy bars, cakes, chocolates, and other goodies. Prioritize your taste and your figure!
Care for a snack? Always have healthy options at hand (raw vegetable sticks, light dairy) and avoid processed food and sugar.
Care for a morning workout? Have a breakfast thats rich in protein, dairy, and whole grains like whole-grain bread and cereal without added sugar.
Hungry? Are you raring for lunch? Stop! Have a healthy snack instead so you can resume your work quietly.
Dont forget pleasure! Just because youre dieting does it mean everythings off-limits. Use the list of food equivalents to keep yourself happy.
Want healthy and tasty snack ideas? 2 squares of 70% dark chocolate, a handful of almonds, some dried fruit, a fruit cup, raw vegetable sticks, or dairy.
A warm soup for dinner is an ally for your program. It fills you up with cooked vegetables and is easy to digest.
Good morning! Eat according to the season to avoid monotony Pears, kiwis, oranges in winter. Apricots, berries, peaches, and melon in the summer!
Healthy snack ideas: fruit cups, fruit packs, a handful of almonds, some dried fruit
Even a traditional family meal can comply with the rules of your diet. Your loved ones will also benefit from healthy eating. Stay focused!
"Cant live without an afternoon snack? Save your fruit dessert from lunch and keep it for this occasion.
Have dinner as early as possible to make it as far from bedtime as you can. This will improve the quality of your sleep, and therefore your weight loss! Good night!

Eat meat, fish, eggs, or an equivalent source of vegetable protein (soy, combination of grains and legumes) at least once a day. Choose quality protein to maintain muscle mass.
Consume dairy at every meal for protein and calcium, which is important for bone growth and strength.
Starches (grains, potatoes, pulses, bread, cereal, etc) are the basis of our energy supply. Have them at the two main meals of the day and choose less processed starches for the most fiber.

Eat as much as you can when it comes to vegetables (without fat or oil) to get the most vitamins, minerals, and fiber. Eat at least 2 vegetable portions a day (at least 1 raw). Have 2-3 portions a day to be full of energy!
The body needs essential fatty acids are needed for fat-soluble vitamins A, D, E, and K. Consume with moderation, and choose good fats like olive oil or canola oil.
Drink at least 8 glasses of water a day, and keep in mind the only essential drink for the body is water! You can also consider unsweetened tea, coffee, or herbal infusions.
Sweets are not essential for the body and remain food for enjoyment, to be consumed in moderation. Opt for natural sweeteners (honey, stevia, agave, etc.)

HAPI is developed and maintained by HAPILABS. \n\nHAPI provides you with your own personal dietitian on your smartphone. You and your HAPIcoach will work together on your chosen health goal. Take pictures of your meals with the HAPI app, and your dietitian will review them and let you know how you\'re doing towards your goal.

HAPI: Bring your own personal dietitian to the table!

HAPI provides you with your own personal dietitian on your smartphone. You and your HAPIcoach will work together on your chosen health goal. Take pictures of your meals with the HAPI app, and your dietitian will review them and let you know how you're doing towards your goal.

HAPI is developed and maintained by HAPILABS."

Finding the best experts to help you reach your weight loss or healthy eating goals.

Congrats! You posted your\n %s meal with HAPI
By recording your meals\nregularly, you stay focused on\nyour weight loss goal.
By recording your meals\nregularly, you learn how to\nmake better food choices.
By logging your meals,\n you learn to make better food choices\n when you log your meals regularly.
By logging your meals,\n you give yourself the means\n to achieve your goal weight.
By logging your meals,\n you\'ll know if you\'re eating 5 servings \nof fruits and vegetables a day.
By logging your meals,\n you\'ll know if you\'re eating a balanced diet.
By logging your meals, \nyou\'ll know if you\'re consuming \n3 dairy products a day.
By logging your meals,\n you\'ll adopt the ideal diet: protein, \ncarbohydrates, a dairy product, and fruits and vegetables.
By logging your meals, \nyou\'ll be aware of your carbohydrate \nintake: bread, grains, pasta, and starches.
By logging your meals, \nyou\'ll make sure that you\'re eating at least \n2 servings of protein (meat, fish ...) daily.
By logging your meals,\n you\'ll know if you\'re drinking enough, \nat least 1.5L of water a day.
By logging your meals,\n you\'ll adopt the best and most\n effective way of losing weight.
By logging your meals,\n you\'ll be aware that you shouldn\'t\n eat too many salty products (crisps, peanuts ...).
By logging your meals,\n you\'ll identify your small daily\n obsessions: desserts, sweets, snacks, cocktails ...
By logging your meals,\n you\'ll be mindful enough to control\n your fat intake (sausages, sauces, butter, cream ...).
By logging your meals,\n you\'ll make sure that you get to eat\n a balanced meal with the proper portions.
By logging your meals,\n you\'ll get to check the variety of your sources\n of calcium: milk, yoghurt, cheese ...
By logging your meals,\n you get to check your consumption of carbohydrates\n that provide the energy your body needs.
By logging your meals,\n you\'ll make sure that you do not consume\n too many sugary drinks or treats.
By logging your meals,\n you become mindful of what you are really\n eating and, if applicable, your excesses.
By logging your meals,\n you become mindful of what \ntime and how you really eat
By also logging your snacks in \nbetween meals, you get a clearer idea \nof your eating habits.
By logging your meals,\n you\'ll make sure to eat the right amount\n of grains (bread, pasta, rice ...).
By logging your meals,\n you become aware when\n you are hungry in general.
By logging your meals,\n you become aware of the meals\n you crave most often.
By logging your meals, you can easily check if you \nalways eat the same thing.
By logging your meals,\n you become aware of which tastes you\n prefer: salty, sweet, spicy, sour ...
By logging your meals,\n you\'ll learn which textures you \nprefer, crunchy, chewy, liquid....
By logging your meals,\n you get to check if you eat \nenough protein, vegetables and fruit.
By logging your meals, you\'ll understand the situations that lead \nyou to eat even when you\'re not hungry.
By logging your meal, \nyou "officially" document what you really eat, \nboth in quantity and quality.
By logging your meals,\n you spot situations, emotional states \nand the problems that cause you to overeat.
